Comment: It's solid and bug-free. I extensively tested it.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun to think about algorithms.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

oh wow, I love the dice aspect!  I was thinking of how to make a bot for this using MCTS and then remembered the dice constraint totally throwing it all for a loop!  It is going to be really neat what kinds of bots and algorithms people come up with for this.  Also love the game, and thought a wood version would be a nice evening parlor game.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

The rules of the game are clearly laid out, making it easy to understand, but the complexity of the pieces' movements adds an extra layer of thinking.

I particularly enjoyed using the dice to determine the movements of the pieces, as it introduces an element of chance that can make the game more exciting. The promotion and capture rules are also well thought out and added to the strategy in the game.

Overall, this is a great exercise to practice game programming and algorithm skills.

https://www.codingame.com/replay/760411529

This game shows the volatility of the dice mechanic. Player 1 is clearly winning up to frame 22. Very close to mating the opponent king. Then player 2 rolls a 6 and is able to capture the bishop.

Then on frame 25 player 1 is forced to sacrifice his rook as well. Both bishop and rook are lost to unlucky dicerolls. It ironically ends by player 2 dropping the captured rook into a checkmate.

I'm done for now. My MCTS works with a random simulation. It is quite slow still (2k rollouts on turn 2, going up in later turns). It beats the other 3 bots every time, so I have no incentive to optimize.

I do see a lot of jumping in the mcts evaluation in some situations. Sometimes 1 diceroll does make the difference. So the leaderboard will be a bit volatile, but that's to be expected.

I love the game so far. Finished all the perfts today. Sim is perfect.

I think for viewing the game, there should be a westernized option (in debug for example).

I honestly can't figure out what is going on without studying my cerr output.

I'll try to get a mcts working tomorrow that also includes the dice mechanic. I'll let you know how this turns out.

Rules * Movement > Silver General: "It cannot move backward directly." Does "directly" mean "vertically" or "vertically or diagonally"? Suggest to revise accordingly. * Movement > Promoted Silver General (å…¨): It seems to be é‡‘ but in red instead of å…¨. * Dice rolling and movement: Suggest to change "the piece" to "a piece". * Dice rolling and movement: Suggest to change "desired file" to "rolled file". Game input * Pieces notation / Initial input: Suggest to format all notations using the tag and remove the quotation marks. * Initial input: Suggest to format 0 and 1 using the tag. * Input for one game turn: Suggest to format all the texts within quotation marks using the tag and remove the quotation marks. * Input for one game turn > first description: Please delete "Next" in "Next boardSize line", and change "line:" to "lines: line which is". * Input for one game turn > first description: Suggest to change "your grid" to "the board". * Input for one game turn: Please change the line numbers as "Next line:" for the second to fifth descriptions, e.g. Next line: First player's current hand, or - if he has (etc.) * Input for one game turn > Last description: Please change "action:" to "lines: action which is". * Input for one game turn > Last description: Suggest to change "the action" to "a legal action". * Description for the input of [[actionCount]] is missing (I mean: action_count = int(input()) ). Output * Suggest to format columnFrom, rowFrom, columnTo, rowTo and Piece using the tag. * Please format "+", "*" and "4534 Take this!" using the tag and remove the quotation marks. Viewer * The viewer shows the word "TICTACTOE" initially? Thanks.
I'm still thinking whether or not should I (also) submit normal minishogi.

Outside from the statement, logo, demo etc. to be done, I'm still thinking on the few things:
- should the notation be like in typical shogi?
  - if yes, should the dice roll 1 be the most right column so not to be confused? ludii for example takes 1 as most left column
The notation is good as is.

I would love to have normal minishogi, but I think for CG in general it is probably better not to have too many similar games. But if a lot of people also want normal minishogi, that'd be cool.

Dice shogi is original and different from other games. I like it.
Updated most statement. Thanks, it looks better now. Logo still "in work", hopefully I won't forget to change it on final release :v
Added western piece set in options.
That's the issue or feature of games involving random chance.
yep
Thank you for the changes. I'll review it again after you've filled in more gaps ðŸ˜‰

Rules * Captures: Suggest to rewrite the first part as follows: When a player's piece goes into a square occupied by the opponent's piece, the opponent's piece is captured and goes unpromoted into the player's hand. * Drops: Suggest to change "do it" to "do so". Loss Conditions * Point 2: Please change "you turn" to "your turn". Game input * Pieces notation: Please change "king" to "King" (twice). * Pieces notation: Please change "Promoted Silver" to "Promoted Silver General" (twice). * Input for one game turn: Suggest to change (from 2nd description onwards) as follows. Please note in particular I've added the second last description for actionCount. Next line: First player's current hand, or - if he has no pieces in the hand. Examples: -, G, BB
Next line: Second player's current hand, or - if he has no pieces in the hand. Examples: -, g, bb
Next line: Value of the rolled die.
Next line: Last opponent's action or none if first turn of first player.
Next line: actionCount for the number of legal actions for this turn.
Next actionCount lines: a string representing a legal action. Viewer * "TICTACTOE" viewer - pending change. Thanks.
Done, and even changed the tictactoe logo.
Great! The logo will probably look nicer if it's spelled as two words, but it's fine as is.
90% work done on engine/bot side in 3 days. The rest 10% which is statement, logo, cover, will take 3 months (:
